name: International Commitee on the Rights of Sex Workers in Europe
goal: The International Committee on the Rights of Sex Workers in Europe (ICRSE) strives to raise awareness about the social exclusion of female, male and transgender sex workers in Europe, to promote the human and civil rights of all sex workers at national, regional and global levels and to create strong alliances between sex workers, allies and other civil society organisations. The ICRSE maintains strong links with existing sub-regional, regional and global networks, supports the further development of nascent groups and networks of sex workers and provides a platform for the voices of sex workers in Europe to be heard in local, regional and global policy debates.
interests: Employment and Social Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health
euInitiatives: Resolutions and policies related to prostitution, women's rights, trafficking, LGBT rights, migrants' rights and social inclusion.
